snippet: French officials revealed that one of the attackers was carrying a Syrian passport, and perhaps may have entered Europe along the migrant trail. Poland moved first to shut the door.
abstract: Terrorist attacks in Paris, and knowledge that one attacker may have entered Europe along migrant pathway, has intensified backlash in region already wary and divided over how to respond to tide of migrants from Middle East and Africa; Poland backs away from plan to distribute 160,000 refugees throughout bloc, potentially dooming undertaking.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and RICK LYMAN
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Rick Lyman from Warsaw. Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin; Miroslava Germanova from Bratislava, Slovakia; Aurelien Breeden from Paris; and Richard Martyn-Hemphill from Riga, Latvia.

lead_paragraph: French officials revealed that one of the attackers was carrying a Syrian passport, and perhaps may have entered Europe along the migrant trail. Poland moved first to shut the door.

headline.main: Attacker’s Possible Link to Migrant Trail Heightens Security Fears
headline.print_headline: Brand-New Fright as Europe Strains With Migrant Tide

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
